latex: Convex quadrilateral $ABCD$ has right angles $\angle A$ and $\angle C$ and is such that $AB=BC$ and $AD=CD$.  The diagonals $AC$ and $BD$ intersect at point $M$.  Points $P$ and $Q$ lie on the circumcircle of triangle $AMB$ and segment $CD$, respectively, such that points $P$, $M$, and $Q$ are collinear.  Suppose that $m\angle ABC=160^\circ$ and $m\angle QMC=40^\circ$.  Find $MP\cdot MQ$, given that $MC=6$.
